required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of Campbell Score With Suicidal Ideation
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Campbell Score as a Means of Predicting Suicidal Ideation High Risk Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
The Campbell Score is a blood based means of assessing molecules believed to be associated with suicidal ideation and in some cases successful suicide.
The current clinical trial will assess the Campbell Score in 3 groups:
Group 1: 10 patients with no personal or family psychiatric history and no suicide attempts.
Group 2: 10 patients with suicidal ideation (Hamilton Depression Rating Scale suicide item >2) and reported low acquired capability for suicide (Acquired Capability for Suicide Scale <20).
Group 3: 10 patients with suicidal ideation (Hamilton Depression Rating Scale suicide item >2) and reported high acquired capability for suicide (Acquired Capability for Suicide Scale >60).
The goal of the study is to confirm efficacy of Campbell Score in identifying patients with high suicidal ideation potential.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week to compare the records with the Campbell Score
primary_outcome.description: Campbell Score will be compared between healthy volunteers, patients with suicidal idea with low acquired capability for suicide, and patients with suicidal idea with high acquired capability for suicide.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Correlation between Campbell Score and Beck Scale for Suicidal Ideation
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week to compare the records with the Campbell Score
primary_outcome.description: Campbell Score will be compared to scoring of patients on the Beck Scale for Suicidal Ideation

arm_group.description: Subjects will have no personal or family psychiatric history and no suicide attempts.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with Suicidal Ideation and Low Acquired Capability
arm_group.description: Subjects will have suicidal ideation (Hamilton Depression Rating Scale suicide item >2) and reported low acquired capability for suicide (Acquired Capability for Suicide Scale <20)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with Suicidal Ideation and High Acquired Capability
arm_group.description: Subjects will have suicidal ideation (Hamilton Depression Rating Scale suicide item >2) and reported high acquired capability for suicide (Acquired Capability for Suicide Scale >60)

intervention.description: The Campbell Score is a blood based assessment of inflammatory and immunologically associated markers that is currently in development as a means of predicting suicidal ideations.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with Suicidal Ideation and High Acquired Capability
Patients with Suicidal Ideation and Low Acquired Capability

study_pop.textblock: The study population will comprise of 10 healthy volunteers, as well as 20 patients with suicidal ideations. 10 of the patients will have low acquired capability for suicide, and 10 will have high acquired capability for suicide.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Capability of giving informed consent
- Agree to abide by the study protocol and its restrictions and be able to complete all aspects of the study.
- Be diagnosed with Suicide ideation/attempts/gestures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not currently pregnant or lactating (due to potential confounding of brain activity as a result of differing hormone levels)
